snippet: Participants in the federal Section 8 voucher program who live alone in a one-bedroom unit no longer have to move to studio apartments.
abstract: New York City's Department of Housing Preservation and Development partly reverse policy that would have forced thousands of low-income tenants in federal Section 8 voucher program who live alone to smaller apartments; leaves tenants with option of staying put if they pay higher share of rent.
lead_paragraph: Participants in the federal Section 8 voucher program who live alone in a one-bedroom unit no longer have to move to studio apartments.

headline.main: New York City Housing Dept. Eases Rule Forcing Low-Income Tenants to Downsize
headline.print_headline: Rule Forcing Recipients of Rent Subsidy to Downsize Is Eased

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
